name: Dead Code
description: The product contains dead code, which can never be executed.
extended_description: Dead code is code that can never be executed in a running program. The surrounding code makes it impossible for a section of code to ever be executed.

common_consequences.note: Dead code that results from code that can never be executed is an indication of problems with the source code that needs to be fixed and is an indication of poor quality.

description: Remove dead code before deploying the application.
Use a static analysis tool to spot dead code.

demonstrative_examples.text:
<Intro_Text>The condition for the second if statement is impossible to satisfy. It requires that the variables be non-null, while on the only path where s can be assigned a non-null value there is a return statement.</Intro_Text>
               <Example_Code Nature="Bad" Language="C++">
                  <xhtml:div>String s = null;<xhtml:br/>if (b) {<xhtml:div style="margin-left:1em;">s = "Yes";<xhtml:br/>return;</xhtml:div>}<xhtml:br/>
                     <xhtml:br/>if (s != null) {<xhtml:div style="margin-left:1em;">Dead();</xhtml:div>}</xhtml:div>
               </Example_Code>

<Intro_Text>In the following class, two private methods call each other, but since neither one is ever invoked from anywhere else, they are both dead code.</Intro_Text>
               <Example_Code Nature="Bad" Language="Java">
                  <xhtml:div>public class DoubleDead {<xhtml:div style="margin-left:1em;">private void doTweedledee() {<xhtml:div style="margin-left:1em;">doTweedledumb();</xhtml:div>}<xhtml:br/>private void doTweedledumb() {<xhtml:div style="margin-left:1em;">doTweedledee();</xhtml:div>}<xhtml:br/>public static void main(String[] args) {<xhtml:div style="margin-left:1em;">System.out.println("running DoubleDead");</xhtml:div>}</xhtml:div>}</xhtml:div>
               </Example_Code>
               <Body_Text>(In this case it is a good thing that the methods are dead: invoking either one would cause an infinite loop.)</Body_Text>

<Intro_Text>The field named glue is not used in the following class. The author of the class has accidentally put quotes around the field name, transforming it into a string constant.</Intro_Text>
               <Example_Code Nature="Bad" Language="Java">
                  <xhtml:div>public class Dead {<xhtml:div style="margin-left:1em;">
                        <xhtml:div>String glue;<xhtml:br/>
                           <xhtml:br/>public String getGlue() {<xhtml:div style="margin-left:1em;">return "glue";</xhtml:div>}</xhtml:div>
                     </xhtml:div>}</xhtml:div>
               </Example_Code>

observed_examples.description: chain: incorrect "goto" in Apple SSL product bypasses certificate validation, allowing Adversary-in-the-Middle (AITM) attack (Apple "goto fail" bug). CWE-705 (Incorrect Control Flow Scoping) -> CWE-561 (Dead Code) -> CWE-295 (Improper Certificate Validation) -> CWE-393 (Return of Wrong Status Code) -> CWE-300 (Channel Accessible by Non-Endpoint).

modification.modification_comment: updated Common_Consequences, References, Relationships, Taxonomy_Mappings, Weakness_Ordinalities

detection_methods.description:
<xhtml:p>According to SOAR, the following detection techniques may be useful:</xhtml:p>
                  <xhtml:div style="margin-left:1em;">
                     <xhtml:div>Highly cost effective:</xhtml:div>
                        <xhtml:ul>
                           <xhtml:li>Inspection (IEEE 1028 standard) (can apply to requirements, design, source code, etc.)</xhtml:li>
                           <xhtml:li>Formal Methods / Correct-By-Construction</xhtml:li>
                        </xhtml:ul>
                     <xhtml:div>Cost effective for partial coverage:</xhtml:div>
                        <xhtml:ul>
                           <xhtml:li>Attack Modeling</xhtml:li>
                        </xhtml:ul>
                  </xhtml:div>

detection_methods.method: Automated Static Analysis - Binary or Bytecode
detection_methods.description:
<xhtml:p>According to SOAR, the following detection techniques may be useful:</xhtml:p>
                  <xhtml:div style="margin-left:1em;">
                     <xhtml:div>Highly cost effective:</xhtml:div>
                        <xhtml:ul>
                           <xhtml:li>Binary / Bytecode Quality Analysis</xhtml:li>
                           <xhtml:li>Compare binary / bytecode to application permission manifest</xhtml:li>
                        </xhtml:ul>
                  </xhtml:div>

detection_methods.method: Dynamic Analysis with Manual Results Interpretation
detection_methods.description:
<xhtml:p>According to SOAR, the following detection techniques may be useful:</xhtml:p>

<xhtml:p>According to SOAR, the following detection techniques may be useful:</xhtml:p>

                        </xhtml:ul>
                  </xhtml:div>

detection_methods.method: Dynamic Analysis with Automated Results Interpretation
